Comment: Anything surrounded by < > can be deleted, thats just me trying to work out the bytecode.

Dialog_Entries.text: .<Player/Chocobo Parameter>A recruit. What do you want with this gatehouse.<Prompt>
Only citizens of San d'Oria may apply for missions here. Go see your country's consulate in Northern San d'Oria.<Prompt>
Finish your current mission first, then come back for another.<Prompt>

Which mission will you undertake. <Selection Dialog>Smash the Orcish Scouts. Bat Hunt. Save the Children. The Rescue Drill. The Davoi Report. Journey Abroad. Journey to Bastok. Journey to Windurst. Journey to Bastok. Journey to Windurst. Infiltrate Davoi. The Crystal Spring. Appointment to Jeuno. Magicite. The Ruins of Fei'Yin. The Shadow Lord. Leaute's Last Wishes. Ranperre's Final Rest. Prestige of the Papsque. The Secret Weapon. Coming of Age. Lightbringer. Breaking Barriers. The Heir to the Light. 10-1. 10-2. ._.~.[26. ._.~.[27. ._.~.[28. ._.~.[29. ._.~.[30. None.<Prompt>
Accept this mission. <Selection Dialog>Yes. No.<Prompt>
You accept the mission.<Prompt>
What do you want with this gatehouse.<Prompt>
Your business. <Selection Dialog>A mission, please. Nothing.<Prompt>
Hmm...not much work for those wet behind the ears, but...<Prompt>
How about slaying Orcish scouts. Only the yellowest of yearlings would run from that, and we've no work for cowards here.<Prompt>
If you're to take the mission, I'll be happy to explain.<Prompt>
Interested. <Selection Dialog>Tell me more. Never mind.<Prompt>
Here's your mission. Orcish scouts roam outside; kill one and bring me his axe as proof.<Prompt>
You'll have to bring me <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$  . No other kind will do. Understand.<Prompt>
That is all. You'll take the mission then.<Prompt>
Do you accept the mission. <Selection Dialog>I accept. Could you explain again. No, thank you.<Prompt>
Bring me one of those axes, and your mission will be a success. No running away now; we've a proud country to defend!<Prompt>
Oh, you're back. Well, if you're so happy you defeated an Orc or two, you've a long way ahead of you!<Prompt>
That's another <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>#   for the armory, then. Mission complete! Not bad for a new recruit.<Prompt>
What. I don't want this!<Prompt>
Are you really a new recruit!.<Prompt>
Listen, before you bring me something, you must first accept the mission! That is how things work around here!<Prompt>
Persistent, aren't you. An Orc under the belt does not a hero make! Ah, I've just the job for you...<Prompt>
Bat patrol! How about it. Shouldn't be a problem for an adventurer such as yourself, no.<Prompt>
Here's your mission, then. Clear out bats lurking in King Ranperre's Tomb and bring me a fang as proof.<Prompt>
Bring me <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$   and your mission will be a success.<Prompt>
Deep in the tomb you'll find Goblins. Take care; I don't want to lose you yet.<Prompt>
Ah, you've returned! I was afraid that Goblins got you.<Prompt>
That's one <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>#   for the gatehouse, then. Mission complete. Not bad for a new recruit.<Prompt>
Ah, the recruit's back again. I'm sorry, but I've no time for you today.<Prompt>
Well, perhaps you can be of some help. Many of our children have disappeared mysteriously, and I've no doubt the Ghelsba Orcs are behind it.<Prompt>
The Royal Knights should be on the job by now, but the two princes are at each other's throats.<Prompt>
Prince Trion, the eldest, says we should launch a full attack, with all haste.<Prompt>
While his younger brother, Prince Pieuje says the safety of the children comes first, and he won't authorize an attack.<Prompt>
They've been arguing this back and forth for days. The knights' hands are tied, and frankly, nobody knows what to do.<Prompt>
If you really want to make a name for yourself, go to Ghelsba, and rescue those kidnapped children!<Prompt>
What say you. Will you go.<Prompt>
Here's your mission, then. Rescue the two children kidnapped by the Orcs of Ghelsba Outpost.<Prompt>
Ghelsba Outpost is northwest of West Ronfaure. Take the path before the Westgate, then turn right when the path splits in the forest. You'll find the entrance up in the hills.<Prompt>
If you have trouble finding the way, just follow one of the soldiers on patrol.<Prompt>
Orcs tend to keep their hostages in tents or small huts. Once you're inside the compound, check them first.<Prompt>
Ah, you've returned! You were gone so long, I feared a warmachine had got you!<Prompt>
At any rate, mission complete! And to reward your accomplishment...<Prompt>
I hereby recognize you, <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 8)>, as a certified adventurer of San d'Oria! You're now mission rank two, as well.<Prompt>
But don't get too excited. Your title is valid only here in San d'Oria, understand.<Prompt>
In order to become a true adventurer, and bear <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>6  , you must be recognized by Bastok and Windurst as well.<Prompt>
'Tis a treaty between the three lands, and its word is law. I know it's hard, but those are the rules.<Prompt>
For now, cut your adventuring teeth in the areas near here. Sooner or later you'll find your way into other lands.<Prompt>
You achieve rank 2!<Prompt>
There's not much work in right now. I suppose you could go participate in the Temple Knights' rescue drills out on the La Theine Plateau.<Prompt>
Enter the forest beyond the Westgate and head southwest. You'll come out onto the La Theine Plateau before long.<Prompt>
Once you're out on the plateau, keep going until you see the knights. The training grounds aren't far from there.<Prompt>
It's all just a drill, so this should be easy compared to your usual fare. Just follow orders and you'll be fine.<Prompt>
You've returned! I hear the drill turned into something far more perilous. But real battle is the best drill for recruits, in my opinion.<Prompt>
Regardless, you've done well. I'll turn to you when there's work to be done, now.<Prompt>
Here, take this <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>#  . Go ahead, you've earned it.<Prompt>
This time it's messenger duty. One of our knights is out scouting in a place called Davoi, on the southern edge of Jugner Forest.<Prompt>
The Orcs' stronghold is in Davoi, so it's vital that we stop them from massing, or they may launch an assault.<Prompt>
Of course, the Orcs are keeping an eye on us, too. Why, just a few days past, a squad of our Royal Knights fell to their axes.<Prompt>
We have sent scouts to find a weakness in their defenses. You must find the scout there now, and bring back the latest scouting report.<Prompt>
The scout's name is Zantaviat. He's somewhere in Davoi, but where I cannot say.<Prompt>
Come back after you've gotten the report. Those lands are no place to wander.<Prompt>
You have returned! And you've brought the scouting report. Good work, <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 8)>.<Prompt>
Troubling news, this is. It says that Orcs are gathering deep inside the encampment. The time to act is coming!<Prompt>
But that is not your concern. You've done well today. Mission complete!<Prompt>
Oh, it's you, <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 8)>. And at just the right time, too. Monarlais Halver is looking for an adventurer such as yourself.<Prompt>
Enter Chateau d'Oraguille. Monarlais Halver is there; he'll explain in person.<Prompt>
What. You haven't been certified in Bastok and Windurst yet. You may dally, but others are not! Get moving!<Prompt>
Ah, welcome back. I see you've been certified in Bastok and Windurst. Good work. You'll make a fine adventurer.<Prompt>
What's that, a report for our kingdom. I see. Take that to the monarlais when you go.<Prompt>
You should receive <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>6   from Monarlais Halver. Now, go to Chateau d'Oraguille and let them know you're back!<Prompt>
Hurry to Chateau d'Oraguille and give that report to Monarlais Halver!<Prompt>
You achieve rank 3!<Prompt>
Ah! You've come at just the right time. Zantaviat, one of our scouts in Davoi, needs an adventurer.<Prompt>
He wants someone to infiltrate Davoi and scout behind enemy lines. Know anyone fitting that description.<Prompt>
Now that you've got your <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>3  , this is an opportunity to prove you're worth it!<Prompt>
The situation in Davoi worsens by the day. This won't be easy, but I can't think of a better adventurer for the job!<Prompt>
You've returned! Zantaviat told me everything. Congratulations on a job well done!<Prompt>
But we can't let down our guard yet. Those Orcs will not just sit there. We must keep constant vigil, and move before they do!<Prompt>
Here's your reward: <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$  . You're becoming quite the adventurer, aren't you.<Prompt>
Welcome back! I have an important mission for you this time. Recently, land is eroding due to crystal formation...and it's getting worse.<Prompt>
There's a small spring on the eastern edge of Jugner Forest, called Crystwater Spring. We must know what effect crystal formation has on the wildlife there.<Prompt>

I want you to get me a fish from the spring. And not just any fish! You need to get <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$  .<Prompt>
Ah, that reminds me--have you any fishing gear. You'll need some for this mission.<Prompt>
There are people about that know a thing or two about fishing, should you need help finding and choosing your gear.<Prompt>
Ah, the great angler returns! I was worried, to be honest. All you hear these days is the massing of beasts, the erosion of the Crystal Lines, and now...<Prompt>
...rumors that the Shadow Lord himself has returned!<Prompt>
We will examine the fish you brought. Depending on the results, we may need to act! I'll let you know if we need your help.<Prompt>
Ah, it's you, <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 8)>. You've come at a good time. I've news for you.<Prompt>
By order of the Kingdom of San d'Oria, you're to head to Jeuno as an ambassadorial attach.i.<Prompt>
Go to Chateau d'Oraguille. Monarlais Halver will tell you all you need to know.<Prompt>
<Prompt>
<Prompt>
<Prompt>
<Prompt>
<Prompt>
<Prompt>
<Prompt>
<Prompt>
There you are! I've been looking for you. Monarlais Halver requests your presence at the chateau immediately.<Prompt>
It sounds as if this is a fairly important mission. I need not remind you that you should take care to properly equip yourself before embarking on this journey.<Prompt>
I'm not sure what it's about, but you'd best make haste. The monarlais is not to be kept waiting!<Prompt>
Why, if it isn't <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 8)>! This is no time for loafing around, friend! Prince Trion is looking for you.<Prompt>
For this next mission, he's requested you personally. You should be honored!<Prompt>
As for the details of the mission, I've no idea what he wants, but he was in a hurry. You'd best be off to Chateau d'Oraguille!<Prompt>
It is a great thing you've done, <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 8)>! I knew deep in my heart that you were the one for the task.<Prompt>
You'd better get to the chateau quick. They're all waiting to welcome you back, I'd wager.<Prompt>
You've saved our proud Kingdom of San d'Oria. No, you're the savior of all Vana'diel! There's not a soul that doesn't owe you a great debt, <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 8)>.<Prompt>
Ah, if it isn't <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 8)>! You had best hurry off to Chateau d'Oraguille. It seems as if something terrible is in the works there.<Prompt>
Well, if it isn't <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 8)>! Your timing is perfect. The chateau just sent a request for an adventurer.<Prompt>
It looks as if this next mission has something to do with the late queen. You should feel honored. It's not every day that an adventurer gets to work directly with the royal family.<Prompt>
Spoken like a true San d'Orian! Now hurry off to Chateau d'Oraguille and get the details on the mission from Monarlais Halver.<Prompt>
What's wrong. Dealing with royalty is not your cup of tea. Well, think about it and come back when you've come to your senses.<Prompt>
Prince Trion is requesting the aid of an adventurer. How about it.<Prompt>
It looks fairly urgent, so you should hurry to the chateau. The prince is waiting in his chambers.<Prompt>
I expected more from you, <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 8)>. If you change your mind, return here. I'll be waiting.<Prompt>
I have received the details of your mission from Prince Trion. I will deliver this book to the scholars for deciphering.<Prompt>
The deciphering of the <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>3   will take a considerable amount of time. Return later for a report.<Prompt>
You handed the <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>3   over to the guard.<Prompt>

Ah, <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 8)>. We've been waiting. Prince Trion is calling for you. I wonder if this means the <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>3   has been completely deciphered.<Prompt>
Well done, <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 8)>! I knew you would not let the Kingdom down.<Prompt>
I'm proud to increase your rank to 7!<Prompt>
The papsque has work for you, <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 8)>. Are you willing to take on the task.<Prompt>
Excellent. Proceed to the papsque's chambers on the third floor of the cathedral.<Prompt>
The papsque often comes across as a difficult man, but he is actually very kindhearted and compassionate. If you change your mind, I'll be waiting here.<Prompt>
The fair Claidie I d'Oraguille has invited you to the chateau. She wishes for you to see the flowers that have bloomed from the seeds you brought back from Altepa.<Prompt>
It is an honor to be invited to the chateau garden. One day you may even have the opportunity to attend one of their royal garden parties.<Prompt>
We cannot keep the princess waiting. Now, off to the chateau!<Prompt>
A party of Royal Knights stationed in Ghelsba Outpost have reported strange activity by Orcs deep within Yughott Grotto.<Prompt>
From your reports, we already know that the beastmen have built a giant portal, but their motives remain unclear.<Prompt>
It makes me shudder to think of what those Orcs are planning with that portal...<Prompt>
<Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 8)>, your next mission is to travel to Ghelsba and continue your investigation into the Orcs' activities.<Prompt>
Be on your guard when traveling deep into Yughott Grotto. Losing an adventurer such as yourself would deal a great blow to all of San d'Oria.<Prompt>
I see you need more time for preparations. When you are ready, I'll be waiting.<Prompt>
It's hard to believe Orcs have their hands on such dangerous equipment. More patrols will have to be sent out to prevent any new developments in their evil plans.<Prompt>

And this <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>3  ... We will have to analyze it and begin reproduction for our forces. We cannot let Orcs get the Treasure of the Dragon King before San d'Oria does.<Prompt>
Well, congratulations on the completion of your mission. Hmmm. Do I know of an adventurer named Eideialc. Never heard of him.<Prompt>
But you need not worry about some petty traveler. You are in a different league. You are now rank 8!<Prompt>
Princess Claidie's coming-of-age ceremony is drawing near. This ceremony is an important facet of d'Oraguille tradition.<Prompt>
Monarlais Halver has put out a call to high-ranking adventurers for their assistance in Chateau d'Oraguille.<Prompt>
Ah, the young princess has finally become a lady... Oh, I'm sorry. You can get the details of your next mission from Sir Halver.<Prompt>
What. You do not wish to repay the kindness the princess has shown to you in the past months. As you wish...but if you change your mind, you know where to find me.<Prompt>
I am busy with preparations for Princess Claidie's coming-of-age ceremony. You don't know what kind of vermin could be roaming the streets and looking for trouble.<Prompt>
Princess Claidie's coming-of-age ceremony is about to begin at the cathedral. I must remain at my post, but why don't you attend.<Prompt>
The king has requested your audience. He has selected you from the mountain of adventurers in San d'Oria. You should feel honored!<Prompt>
You have matured from a fledgling adventurer into a great asset to our kingdom. Do not let us down.<Prompt>
There is no need for modesty at a time like this. The fate of San d'Oria is at stake!<Prompt>
The authorities are saying that a dark cloud of despair is looming over the Kingdom. They are asking for the assistance of only the best adventurers.<Prompt>
I can think of none more qualified than you. Will you accept this mission.<Prompt>
Then proceed to the Audience Chamber in the Chateau d'Oraguille. Word has it that His Highness is not feeling that well. He may not be present for your briefing.<Prompt>
<Prompt>.[Sir/Lady] <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 8)>! The Kingdom is counting on you. Who else, I ask you, is worthy for this task.<Prompt>

Ah, a time of great change is upon us. In a matter of days, the Rites of Succession will be held at the cathedral in Northern San d'Oria. It is then that the new heir to the throne will be decided.<Prompt>

Due to the unpredictable circumstances that took place at the princess's coming-of-age ceremony, this time, only authorized personnel will be allowed near the proceedings. However, the royal family has requested your services as a guard.<Prompt>
Even we Royal Knights have not been granted permission to attend... You must be held in high regard by His Highness. I envy you, <Prompt>.[Sir/Ma'am].<Prompt>
When you have finished your preparations, proceed directly to the cathedral to report.<Prompt>
Off the record, which of the two princes do you think should be the next heir to the throne.<Prompt>
It is a difficult decision, but... <Selection Dialog>Trion is better suited. Pieuje is better suited.<Prompt>
Hm... Being the oldest, he is the true heir, and many people believe he is the most suited to rule the Kingdom. However, Prince Pieuje's prudent ways may be what this country is lacking.<Prompt>

Many think as you do, <Prompt>.[Sir/Lady] <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 8)>. However, what this country may need is someone who will not back down in the face of a threat--someone who will stand up for the pride of the Kingdom.<Prompt>

But our opinion is of no matter. Lightbringer will decide who is the most suited to stand over our fine nation. And do not speak a word of today's exchange, for the monarlais will have our heads if he finds out.<Prompt>
I realize that you must have many preparations before taking on such an important mission. Take your time and return here when you are ready.<Prompt>

Clear Conditions Fulfilled: <Selection Dialog>1-1.@Brought back Orcish Axe. 1-2.@Brought back Bat Fang. 1-3.@Rescued the children. 2-1.@Training complete. 2-2.@Finished Davoi village. 2-3.@Visited other countries. 3-1.@Davoi Killing Grounds. 3-2. 3-3. 4-1. 4-2. 4-3. 5-1. 5-2. 5-3. 6-1. 6-2. 7-1. 7-2. 8-1. 8-2. 9-1. 9-2. 10-1. 10-2.<Prompt>
The San d'Oria residential area is ahead. You'll find your Mog House within.<Prompt>
I've not told you about Mog Houses yet, have I. Would you care to learn about them now.<Prompt>
Care to learn about Mog Houses. <Selection Dialog>Sure! No, thanks.<Prompt>
Mog Houses are useful places. You can recover your HP and MP, and store items there.<Prompt>
You can also change jobs there. All adventurers of San d'Orian citizenship are assigned a Mog House.<Prompt>
Make yourself at home!<Prompt>
The San d'Oria residential area is ahead. You'll find your Mog House within.<Prompt>
Would you like to hear about Mog Houses again.<Prompt>
Hmm... So be it.<Prompt>
Ahead lies the residential area. You'll find your Mog House within.<Prompt>
By the way, my records indicate that you're renting a room in <Multiple Choice (Parameter 0)>[San d'Oria/Bastok/Windurst/Jeuno/Kazham/Rabao/Norg/Al Zahbi].<Prompt>
Would you like to check out of the room in <Multiple Choice (Parameter 0)>[San d'Oria/Bastok/Windurst/Jeuno/Kazham/Rabao/Norg/Al Zahbi] and move your things back here.<Prompt>
Move back to San d'Oria. <Selection Dialog>Yes, please. No, not yet.<Prompt>
It is done. We've checked you out of your Rent-a-Room in <Multiple Choice (Parameter 0)>[San d'Oria/Bastok/Windurst/Jeuno/Kazham/Rabao/Norg/Al Zahbi].<Prompt>
All your belongings should be waiting for you inside. Those moogles are amazing creatures, are they not.<Prompt>
Ahead lies the residential area. Proceed to your Rent-a-Room, foreigner!<Prompt>
If you're already renting here, you may come and go as you please, like the Mog House in your homeland.<Prompt>
Ahead lies the residential area.<Prompt>
Wait! By law, all foreigners must lease a Rent-a-Room before entering the residential area!<Prompt>
Once you've registered with us, you can use it as you would a Mog House back home, wherever that may be.<Prompt>
Will you stay in San d'Oria. <Selection Dialog>Yes. No, I'd rather not.<Prompt>
All right, then. A San d'Orian Rent-a-Room has been leased to your name. Now move along, foreigner!<Prompt>
You can set this as your current home point. Once you set a home point, you will return there whenever you are incapacitated
Set this as current home point. <Selection Dialog>Yes. No.<Prompt>
Home point set!<Prompt>
A home point can be set as a spot for you to return to Vana'diel when you have been knocked out. You can also use a home point to teleport to other home points
What will you do. <Selection Dialog>Travel to another home point. Set this as your home point. Other settings. On second thought, never mind.<Prompt>
You have registered a new home point! You are now able to teleport here from any other home point.<Prompt>
You may teleport from here to any other home point you have registered

I think we have covered all of the topics on our agenda today.<Prompt>
If there are no objections, I would like to call the 136th Conquest Evaluation Assembly to a close.<Prompt>
Just a moment.<Prompt>
Prince Trion, is there something you wish to add.<Prompt>
... I will not deny that the participation of adventurers has been of great benefit to the conquest, as well as maintained a new level of safety in the outlying regions.<Prompt>
In addition, the many treaties signed by our nations have successfully paved a path of peace. No longer need our border guards fear attacks from our friends to the south and east.<Prompt>
However, the beastman forces display no signs of weakening. Those noble guards stationed in faraway lands must deal with this reality constantly...and the burden has begun taking its toll.<Prompt>
The already large gap between the guards on our borders and the guards in the Outlands expands with each day. If nothing is done, morale shall continue to fall while discontent grows.<Prompt>
I sense that my kingdom is not alone in these worries.<Prompt>
Soldier morale...<Prompt>
Well, well, well! I never thought I'd see such a lack of confidence from a member of the mighty d'Oraguille family!<Prompt>
Ohohoho! I never thought I'd see such a lack of confidence from Destin's baby boy--Trion, the prince.<Prompt>
How dare you!.<Prompt>
I think that is quite enough, Minister.<Prompt>
I fully understand the concerns of Prince Trion, and believe he has a point.<Prompt>
Doctor Shantotto... I fully understand the concerns of Prince Trion, and believe he has a point.<Prompt>

In a republic like Bastok, where a large portion of our army is made up of normal citizens, it is easy for morale levels to slide. This is a problem that is constantly being tackled by our officials.<Prompt>
Really. Well, that's your nation. Windurst doesn't face such problems.<Prompt>

Our Mithran Mercenaries enjoy being sent to far-off places. It gives them the opportunity to run and jump and hunt and roll around in the mud--whatever those feminine felines like to do in their free time.<Prompt>
Maybe instead of buffing up your soldiers' muscles all day, you should try training their minds...like we do. And that's my two gil!<Prompt>
Oh, rea.`lly. Well, that's your nation. We don't have such problems in the Federation.<Prompt>
Our Mithran Mercenaries enjoy being sent to faraway places.  It gives them time to take their naps, hunt their mice, and go on their chases.<Prompt>
Maybe it's to the lack of confidence that you can give thanks for the drastic fall of morale in your pathetic ranks.<Prompt>
...<Prompt>
Yes, but hiring mercenaries can be quite the burden on the Federation's treasury, can it not.<Prompt>
Yes, but hiring mercenaries can be quite the burden on the Federation's treasury, can it not.<Prompt>
The more regions under your nation's control, the more mercenaries you must hire. And before you realize it, your vaults will be empty.<Prompt>
I suspect that the conquest is taking its toll on the Federation.<Prompt>
Well, we...<Prompt>
Ohohohoho! In a matter of months, our wishy-worries will be gone, When our Outland regions are patrolled by automatons.<Prompt>

Ballista is an exercise once used by the San d'Orian armies to train the Royal Knights in the art of the siege. The word  ballista  means  to throw a stone,  and the game has been a part of Vana'dielian military history for centuries.<Prompt>
The rules are simple. Ballista is played by two teams over a number of hours (Vana'diel time). The team with the most points at the end of the match is the victor.<Prompt>

Players from both teams must search for <Set colour #5>Petras<Set colour #1> that a <Set colour #5>Herald<Set colour #1> has buried in various locations across the battlefield. The players must then take these stones and throw them into targets known as <Set colour #5>Rooks<Set colour #1>.<Prompt>
These <Set colour #5>Rooks<Set colour #1> can appear in various locations around the battlefield, and both teams are allowed to throw their <Set colour #5>Petras<Set colour #1> into them.<Prompt>
Finally, a player's strength is adjusted depending on his or her level. It is felt that this ultimately allows for a more balanced battle.<Prompt>

<Set colour #5>Petras<Set colour #1> can be buried anywhere. Once a player believes he or she has found one, the <Set colour #5>Quarry<Set colour #1> (/quarry) command should be used to dig up the area at his or her feet.<Prompt>

Sometimes a player may find items other than <Set colour #5>Petras<Set colour #1>, such as potions. These <Set colour #5>temporary items<Set colour #1> can only be used during the current match (or Best of Three series).<Prompt>

Players can carry more than one <Set colour #5>Petra<Set colour #1>, but they cannot throw the stones away once they have obtained them. However, players will lose their <Set colour #5>Petras<Set colour #1> if they: (1) Successfully throw them into a rook. (2) Leave the area. (3) Are knocked out.<Prompt>

But don't forget, a player will be unable to use the <Set colour #5>Sprint<Set colour #1> command while in possession of a <Set colour #5>Petra<Set colour #1>. And, players can only use the <Set colour #5>Scout<Set colour #1> command if they carry one of the stones.<Prompt>
As one can see, careful planning and impeccable timing are the keys to victory.<Prompt>

All participants of Ballista will have the ability to use the <Set colour #5>Sprint<Set colour #1> command. This will temporarily increase one's movement speed, creating a better chance to find and obtain <Set colour #5>Petras<Set colour #1>.<Prompt>

However, remember that once a player has obtained a <Set colour #5>Petra<Set colour #1>, he or she will be unable to use the <Set colour #5>Sprint<Set colour #1> command. In its place, though, one may use the <Set colour #5>Scout<Set colour #1> command.<Prompt>
The locations of the <Set colour #5>Rooks<Set colour #1> are constantly changing. This makes it quite difficult to find the targets by just randomly walking about the area.<Prompt>

Communication with one's team members is, of course, one way to locate <Set colour #5>Rooks<Set colour #1>. However, another way is by using the <Set colour #5>Scout<Set colour #1> command. This will inform a player of the approximate location of the nearest <Set colour #5>Rook<Set colour #1>.<Prompt>

Finally, <Set colour #5>Scout<Set colour #1> can only be used when a player is carrying a <Set colour #5>Petra<Set colour #1>. Because <Set colour #5>Sprint<Set colour #1> cannot be used at this time, players must be weary of approaching enemies.<Prompt>
So, a <Set colour #5>Petra<Set colour #1> has been obtained and a <Set colour #5>Rook<Set colour #1> located. Now all that's left is tossing the stone in, right. Wrong.<Prompt>
There is one aspect of Ballista that has yet to be mentioned...and this is where the real battle begins.<Prompt>

To throw a <Set colour #5>Petra<Set colour #1> into a <Set colour #5>Rook<Set colour #1>, a player must first wait until the <Set colour #5>Rook's<Set colour #1> gate is open. This takes impeccable timing, as the gate is only open for a short while.<Prompt>

But not just anyone can score points this way. A player must first take down a member of the opposing team and achieve <Set colour #5>Gate Breach<Set colour #1> status. Only then will his or her shots count.<Prompt>
This extreme method of combat is what made the ancient game of Ballista famous, and transformed its participants into heroes.<Prompt>
Running about looking for stones is no different from a child's game of hide-and-seek. Knowing when to strike is what separates the men from the boys.<Prompt>

The following match types are area-specific: All or Nothing (one match) * Normal Items Allowed: Jugner Forest All or Nothing (one match) * Normal Items Restricted: Pashhow Marshlands Best of Three (three matches) * Normal Items Allowed: Meriphataud Mountains<Prompt>

<Set colour #5>Best of Three<Set colour #1> series rules are as follows: Winning a match will earn a nation one  match point.  The nation with the most match points at the end of the series will be declared the victor. Winning the third and final match and producing the high scorer will result in two match points awarded. This allows both sides the chance for  come-from-behind  victories.<Prompt>

Between each of the matches, a short interval will be implemented. During this interval, Invisible and Sneak will be cast on all participants. We suggest this time be used to discuss strategies with the other members of your nation's forces.<Prompt>

Players will be forbidden from using any items they bring to the battlefield. Only temporary items that are quarried may be used. A total of fifteen temporary items (though only one of each type) can be carried.<Prompt>
When this rule is in effect, all players will be presented with five complimentary temporary items at the beginning of the match.<Prompt>
For more information on temporary items, refer to the  special rules. <Prompt>

After being KO'd, if a player chooses to be revived at the spot he was defeated, 100% of all HP and 50% of all MP will be restored. In addition, the player will maintain 50% of the TP he had earned.<Prompt>
If a player chooses to return to their force's camp, HP and MP will be fully restored, but all TP will be lost.<Prompt>
Please note that many of the rules previously considered  special  have been fully implemented. Also, several new special rules have been added.<Prompt>

Previously, participants in Ballista were required to use an item the moment they dug it up using the /quarry command. However, players can now stock these items as <Set colour #5>temporary items<Set colour #1> for use at any time during the match.<Prompt>

Players can hold up to ten <Set colour #5>temporary items<Set colour #1>, but only one of each type. If a player finds an item that they already possess, they must use it immediately or throw it away.<Prompt>

If players who possess ten <Set colour #5>temporary items<Set colour #1> find an item that they have not already obtained, they will also have the option to exchange it with one of their current items.<Prompt>

Hello there! Through my teachings I seek to raise the awareness of San d'Oria's fine citizens.<Prompt>
My specialty is the elements and their correlations. Of course, those from abroad are welcome to my knowledge, too.<Prompt>
View the chart of elemental correlations. <Selection Dialog>Yes. No.<Prompt>
Ah...that is a shame. You've been taught all you need to know, have you.<Prompt>
Excellent choice, friend. This may not be the best place for study, but let's get started!<Prompt>
Ever heard of the elements, the most primal forms of energy. There are eight in all.<Prompt>
Behold, they are like a wheel, with arrows forming a circle. This shows how the myriad elements relate to one another.<Prompt>
They are like six serpents in a circle, each biting the tail of the one before it.<Prompt>
I will explain simply. Water puts out fire, whilst the heat of fire melts ice.<Prompt>
Ice blocks wind, whilst wind wears away at earth. Can you see it right there.<Prompt>
Earth steals energy from lightning, whilst lightning throws its bolts into water.<Prompt>
Light and darkness occupy the center. They are in mutual opposition, for one cannot be both at once.<Prompt>
Ah, yes! There's one more thing you should know: the elements are tied closely to the status of your health.<Prompt>
If you'd like to learn more, I am willing to continue.<Prompt>
Are you ready to hear more. <Selection Dialog>Yes, please. No, that will be enough.<Prompt>
Very good! Fire causes disease, ice paralysis, wind silence, earth petrification, lightning stun, and water poison.<Prompt>
Then there is charm, which is caused by light, whilst blindness, curse, and sleep are all the domain of darkness.<Prompt>
Therefore, armor and accessories that resist certain elements also help you avoid status ailments caused by those elements.<Prompt>
That will be all for today's lecture. Should you wish to review, just ask! I teach all who wish to learn.<Prompt>
Welcome! San d'Oria Carpenters' Guild shop, at your service.<Prompt>
San d'Oria Blacksmiths' Guild shop, at your service!<Prompt>
Finding your way around Northern San d'Oria. Let me show you what's where!<Prompt>
View his map. <Selection Dialog>Yes. No.<Prompt>

Laborman's Way runs to the northwest. Down there you can find great centers of industry, like the Carpenters' Guild and the Blacksmiths' Guild.<Prompt>

Henceforth I will check your rank points to determine whether you're ready for the next mission.<Prompt>
The best way to earn rank points is to join the conquest and thereby obtain crystals.<Prompt>
If you want to know more about the conquest, ask the lord knight at any gatehouse.<Prompt>
You need to receive orders from Monarlais Halver in Chateau d'Oraguille for your mission to be deemed official.<Prompt>

What do you wish to know about. <Selection Dialog>Nothing. Conquests. Conquest results. Donating crystals. Conquest points. The effects of controlling regions. Regions controlled by other nations. Regions under beastman control.<Prompt>

All three nations are striving daily to put more regions under their control. This is what we call  conquests.  You can take part in it and serve your country by defeating enemies while you have Signet cast on you.<Prompt>
Each region comprises several areas, and the nation that rids those areas of the most monsters gains control of the region.<Prompt>
Nations receive goods and resources from regions under their control.<Prompt>
So, the more regions we control, the richer our nation becomes.<Prompt>
Border guards are also placed in outposts within regions under our control. They are there to cast Signet on adventurers like yourself.<Prompt>
Once you have your nation's Signet, you will be able to acquire crystals from enemies you defeat.<Prompt>

Not only that, but you will also receive conquest points. You get more conquest points if you defeat enemies in regions that are not under your nation's control. These points can be used to purchase items from guards like myself.<Prompt>
So you see...conquests benefit nations and adventurers alike. We expect you to do your best to serve your country.<Prompt>

You can see the current state of conquests by selecting  Region Info  from the main menu. Conquest results in all regions are regularly recalculated, so you may want to check them from time to time.<Prompt>
Shops in our city will be selling different items according to our conquest rank. The Troupe Valeriano will also visit the nation that finishes first and bring a little joy to its citizens.<Prompt>
You can donate crystals to your nation once you achieve rank 2. Just trade them to guards like myself, and we will ensure they are sent to the proper place.<Prompt>
We would like you to donate crystals to your nation from now on. Just trade them to guards like myself, and we will ensure they are sent to the proper place.<Prompt>
You can acquire crystals by defeating enemies while you have your nation's Signet. Having Signet cast on you is also the only way of taking part in conquests.<Prompt>
Rank points will be awarded to you for each crystal you donate, and you may be offered new missions as your rank goes up.<Prompt>
You also receive rank points for completing missions. Complete missions and take part in conquests to raise your rank and serve your country.<Prompt>
You are awarded conquest points when you defeat monsters while you are taking part in conquests. Select "Region Info" from the menu to check your current number of conquest points.<Prompt>
You can purchase items from guards like myself with your conquest points, but be warned that the number of points you spend will be subtracted from your current total.<Prompt>

When conquest results are announced, you will be told which country controls the region you are in at that time. Sometimes regions may become neutral, or beastmen may even gain control of regions.<Prompt>
If we gain control of a region, border guards will be placed at its outposts to help adventurers like you.<Prompt>
Merchants will also be placed there, and goods from that region will find their way to the local shops here.<Prompt>
Gaining control of regions is the basic principle behind conquests. We need each of you to do your best, and bring our nation to the top of the ranks.<Prompt>
Of course, sometimes we lose regions to other nations...so we must try to take them back before the next conquest results are announced.<Prompt>
As an incentive, we will award you with more conquest points for defeating monsters in those regions.<Prompt>

But if we are allied with another nation, you will only be awarded the regular rate for defeating monsters in our allies' regions. On the other hand, we will award you with more points for fighting in the top-ranked nation's regions.<Prompt>
Our paramount concern lies in the beastmen gaining control of our regions. If too many of us are defeated in a region, the beastmen will gain control of it.<Prompt>
If this happens, not only is it a great blow to our pride, but you will be unable to acquire any crystals in that region.<Prompt>
The beastmen are a menace to all nations. If they rise to power, we must all unite and drive those vile creatures from that region.<Prompt>
We need you to bring supplies to the outpost border guards who are placed in regions under our control.<Prompt>
There is one outpost in each region. Select  Region Info  from the menu, and look for the areas with a small flag mark on the map. That is where they are.<Prompt>

Here are the supplies. Just give them to the guard at the outpost and your mission will be complete. Now, choose which outpost you want to go to. We give different rewards for each region, so choose carefully.<Prompt>

And, as promised, the guild finished all of the beautifully constructed mannequins within the allotted time frame and sent them off to Windurst.<Prompt>

However, as the shipment was being carried down the Phanauet Channel through Jugner Forest, the ferry was attacked by beastmen. The fiends must have thought the ship was a transport vessel for knights and supplies.<Prompt>
The few adventurers that accompanied the ship were no match for the enemy, and the ship and her cargo were lost...<Prompt>

Days later, our guild received a message from Windurst saying that they refused to pay for the stolen mannequins, going as far as citing our negligence in guarding the shipment as justification. But that was not the only problem that arose from the accident... Weeks after the attack, the beastmen began throwing the arms, legs, and heads of their  prizes  over our town walls and into our streets. It was as if they were bragging of their victory.<Prompt>
Seeing this filled the hearts of the townspeople with fear. Mannequins soon became a symbol of ill fate, and those that remained in shops and guilds were destroyed.<Prompt>

As a craftsman, it pains me to know that idle superstition has taken such a precedence over fine work. And that is why, as a craftsman, I give my full support to anyone who wishes to recreate such a product. The basic rules of Brenner are as follows:<Prompt>
First, the participants divide into two teams. Each side's camp contains the same number of  Flammen-Brenner. <Prompt>
At the beginning of the match, half of each side's Flammen-Brenner will be ablaze with  Flamme,  or flame, while the other half will remain unlit.<Prompt>
Participants can seize a Flamme from the opposing side's Flammen-Brenner and carry it around the Isle.<Prompt>
The goal is to steal your opponent's Flamme and use them to light your side's Flammen-Brenner.<Prompt>
The side that succeeds in lighting all of its Flammen-Brenner will be declared the winner after a specified amount of time.<Prompt>
If neither side is victorious before the match ends, the outcome will be judged based on the score. The  match score  section of the rulebook contains more information on this subject.<Prompt>
Brenner is significantly divided into public and private matches. Official matches are held periodically according to level and feature general participation.<Prompt>
You cannot reserve the Isle when an official match is being held.<Prompt>
No items are necessary for participation, but a minor fee will be collected. You will be unable to participate if your level is too low.<Prompt>

The match outcome will be recorded unless the number of participants fails to exceed <Numeric (Parameter 0)> members, or if there are fewer than <Numeric (Parameter 1)> members in a match where the two sides' numbers differ. In such cases, the game will be considered a training match and will not be recorded.<Prompt>
Private matches require a reservation, and participation may be limited. The <Set colour #5>Master of Ceremonies<Set colour #1> (MC) can freely adjust the rules and control match proceedings.<Prompt>
LS Liga  is a form of private match. You can learn more about LS Liga by speaking to a Marshal.<Prompt>
A Flammen-Brenner is a device that contains a Flamme (flame). The Flammen-Brenner is covered by a grate that will open after taking a set amount of damage, exposing the Flamme.<Prompt>
The participants must utilize this chance to seize the Flamme before the grate recloses. Once the grate is closed, the Flammen-Brenner will begin recovering from the damage it has been dealt.<Prompt>
If you manage to open the opposing team's Flammen-Brenner and capture their Flamme, you should make haste to light one of the Flammen-Brenner on your side.<Prompt>
After a certain amount of time, the Flamme will burn out and the opposing team's Flammen-Brenner will be relit.<Prompt>
Also, please note that you cannot quicken your pace using any special abilities while you are in possession of a Flamme.<Prompt>
In the event that neither side fulfills the conditions for victory, the outcome of the match will be evaluated based on score.<Prompt>

Ten points are awarded to each side for every lit Flammen-Brenner, while one point is awarded whenever a Flamme is captured, used to light a Flammen-Brenner, or recaptured from an opponent. One point is also awarded for protecting the Flammen-Brenner for a certain period of time.<Prompt>

Like Ballista, <Set colour #5>quarry<Set colour #1> (/quarry) can be used while playing Brenner. Participants may use this ability to dig up <Set colour #5>Petras<Set colour #1> and temporary items.<Prompt>

However, unlike Ballista Petras, Brenner Petras have no effect on the match score. You can <Set colour #5>trade<Set colour #1> a Petra to a Pursuivant to recover your HP and MP at no expense to TP.<Prompt>
<Set colour #5>Sprint<Set colour #1> cannot be used while carrying a Petra. Also, please note that the <Set colour #5>scout<Set colour #1> ability cannot be used in Brenner.<Prompt>
Petras will be lost in the event of a KO, but can be carried over from one match to another.<Prompt>
The <Set colour #5>sprint<Set colour #1> (/sprint) ability can be used to increase the player's speed when not in possession of a Flamme or Petras.<Prompt>
In the event of a KO, you will be returned to your team's camp. However, recovery will take longer the more often you fall in battle.<Prompt>
In other words, you will receive a penalty if you fall immediately after recovering from KO. In addition, your TP will be reduced to zero and you will lose any Petras in your possession.<Prompt>

What would you like to ask about. <Selection Dialog>The Vana'diel Chocobo Society. Time required. Chocobo attributes. Care schedule. Caring for your chocobo. Feed. Abilities and personality. Retirement. Matchmaking. Calling chocobos in the field. Items. Lost chicks. Nothing.<Prompt>

The Vana'diel Chocobo Society, or VCS for short, is an international organization designed to train and dispatch chocogirls and chocoguys to stables across Vana'diel.<Prompt>
They provide courses on practical chocobo riding and the proper ways to care for a chocobo, as well as working to improve the treatment of chocobos from here to Aht Urhgan.<Prompt>
Anyone can join as long as they love chocobos. The VCS will help you with anything you need.<Prompt>
Chicks hatch from eggs, grow into young chocobos, and finally mature.<Prompt>
They grow much faster than people do. Usually it takes about 1 month (Earth time) before you can ride your chocobo.<Prompt>
The chocobo's traits are determined by the way in which you care for your animal. Without proper planning, you won't be able to raise the type of chocobo that you want.<Prompt>
But don't worry, because you have us to help! We're all in this together!<Prompt>
Ask about which attribute. <Selection Dialog>Strength. Endurance. Discernment. Receptivity. Energy. Affection. Satisfaction. Nothing.<Prompt>

Strength  is a term used to describe the chocobo's leg power. The more strength a chocobo has, the faster it will be able to run. Rental chocobos have been raised with an emphasis on this attribute.<Prompt>
Both strength and endurance are collectively referred to as  Physical attributes. <Prompt>
Endurance  is a term used to describe the chocobo's stamina. If your chocobo has high endurance, you will be able to ride it for a long period of time.<Prompt>
Both strength and endurance are collectively referred to as  Physical attributes. <Prompt>
Discernment  is a must for anyone who wants their chocobo to learn new abilities. You may want to consider raising this attribute if you are interested in digging for treasure.<Prompt>
Both discernment and receptivity are collectively referred to as  Mental attributes. <Prompt>

Receptivity  is a term used to describe the chocobo's sensitivity when dealing with others. You can foster receptivity in your chocobo by giving it lots of opportunities to communicate with other chocobos.<Prompt>
Both discernment and receptivity are collectively referred to as  Mental attributes. <Prompt>

Energy  is a term used to describe the amount of power the chocobo needs to stay active for the day. If your chocobo has a lot of energy, care plans are more likely to be successful and you can provide more direct care for your chocobo.<Prompt>
You can restore your chocobo's energy by feeding it, so remember not to skip out on feeding time after a demanding schedule!<Prompt>
Affection  is the most important attribute of all. Your care schedule will fall flat if you don't show your chocobo proper affection!<Prompt>
You can raise your chocobo's affection by feeding it greens and caring for it on a regular basis.<Prompt>

If you really want to raise your chocobo's affection quickly, you can give it <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$  , but I can't recommend doing so unless absolutely necessary.<Prompt>
Satisfaction  is a term used to describe how full or hungry your chocobo is. If your chocobo is full, it will gain a lot of energy before the next day.<Prompt>
However, when the chocobo is very hungry, its energy will hardly recover at all and its affection will rapidly decrease.<Prompt>

What would you like to ask about. <Selection Dialog>What is a care schedule. Basic care. Resting. Taking a walk. Listening to music. Exercising alone. Exercising in a group. A care schedule is a series of plans that you set up for your chocobo so that we can take care of it while you are away.<Prompt>
How you want us to care for your chocobo each day is completely up to you.<Prompt>
You can register up to four plans at once, each for up to 7 days (Earth time).<Prompt>
When you come to check on your chocobo, we will give you a report on the results. You should listen closely to the report and use it as reference when deciding on a new schedule.<Prompt>
With the basic care plan, we will provide the minimum level of care for your chocobo. This plan is the most stable, and your chocobo will probably not experience any sudden changes.<Prompt>
The basic care plan is good for those who don't want their chocobo's traits to change much or are still unsure of what kind of schedule to choose.<Prompt>
You can select the basic care plan the moment you start raising your chocobo.<Prompt>

We can take your chocobo for a walk in town to improve its physical attributes of strength and endurance. However, it will have a negative effect on its mental attributes of discernment and receptivity.<Prompt>
Listening to music will improve your chocobo's mental attributes of discernment and receptivity. However, it will have a negative effect on its physical attributes of strength and endurance.<Prompt>

If the chocobo is strong, this plan is quite effective, but if the chocobo is weak, then you shouldn't push it too hard.<Prompt>

The most curious of all the worms is the <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>#  . At first it may not seem to have any effect, but looks are deceiving...<Prompt>
Medicines can cure a chocobo in the blink of an eye.<Prompt>

<Prompt>.<Possible Special Code: 01><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$   will restore your chocobo's energy in full, making it easier to care for and ensuring that the care schedule goes smoothly.<Prompt>

<Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Possible Special Item>   are effective for most status abnormalities, restoring instant health to your chocobo. Of course, you still need to continue caring for your chocobo so it can fully recover.<Prompt>
A potion can also help fill a chocobo's stomach, so they can be useful when you are short on feed.<Prompt>
Feed can be ground into paste for chicks to eat.<Prompt>
You can make paste yourself with some cooking skill. If you don't have enough cooking skill yourself, then you might want to ask a friend to make some for you.<Prompt>
Chicks can also eat regular feed, though.<Prompt>
Which would you like to ask about. <Selection Dialog>Abilities. Temperament. Weather preferences. Nothing.<Prompt>
Your chocobo may learn useful abilities during the course of its life at the stables.<Prompt>
For example, Auto-Regen will increase the rate at which your chocobo restores energy. Such an ability is sure to come in handy in a variety of situations.<Prompt>
Your chocobo learns abilities by listening to your words, so if you know of any story that you think might interest the animal, you should tell it often.<Prompt>
But remember, your chocobo can't learn all of the abilities there are. It can only learn two...or at least, that's what I read.<Prompt>
The chocobo's temperament is determined when it is just a chick. Its temperament and attributes are somehow related, but I'm not really sure how.<Prompt>
Chocobos generally like sunny days, but they could grow to like other kinds of weather depending on how they are raised.<Prompt>
Chocobos pay attention to the air outside when they go on walks, and grow to prefer that type of weather because of the memories.<Prompt>

Make the animal's schedule around its preferred weather days, and plans are more likely to succeed. However, if the chocobo has a favored type of weather, it also dislikes certain conditions, creating a weak point to watch for.<Prompt>
You can choose to retire your chocobo at any time after it has fully matured.<Prompt>
After retirement, the VCS will take up caring for the chocobo where you left off, so you need not worry about its welfare.<Prompt>
When your chocobo retires, you will receive <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$  . Be sure not to lose it.<Prompt>

You can use the <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>#   to register your chocobo to call in the field or for matchmaking purposes after retirement. All you need to do is trade it to a VCS member.<Prompt>
The empty stall created after your animal retires can be used for raising other chocobos, so if you happen to come across another egg, you can bring it here to start all over again!<Prompt>
When your chocobo is mature enough, you can breed it with another chocobo. If the chocobo lays an egg, the chick will inherit the traits of its parents.<Prompt>

You will need <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$   and <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$   if you want to breed your chocobo. Apparently, you also need some kind of ticket that they sell at the stables in Upper Jeuno.<Prompt>

You can ask one of the VCS members to issue you a chococard, or if your chocobo is already retired, just trade them <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$  .<Prompt>
I don't really know that much about it, but you should probably try matching your chocobo up with several different animals and seeing what the results are.<Prompt>
When your chocobo is mature enough, you can call it in the field using <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$  .<Prompt>
You need to let a member of the VCS know which chocobo you want to respond to your call, because they must choose a saddle that fits your chocobo's attributes.<Prompt>
That also means that when your chocobo's attributes change or it learns a new ability, you should probably let the VCS member know, too.<Prompt>

When you want to register a retired chocobo to respond to your call in the field, trade <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$   to a VCS member.<Prompt>
Also, the <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>#  's power will grow weak after you've used it several times.<Prompt>
If this happens, just trade it to a VCS member and they will give you a new one for a fee.<Prompt>

What would you like to ask about. <Selection Dialog><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Possible Special Item>  . Chococards. <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Possible Special Item>  . Nothing.<Prompt>

<Prompt>.<Possible Special Code: 01><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$   proves that you are your chocobo's caretaker.<Prompt>
With this card, you can register a retired chocobo to respond to your call in the field or get a chococard for matchmaking.<Prompt>
If you lose it, you won't be able to get another one, so keep it in a safe place!<Prompt>
You can use <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$   to call your chocobo in the field to use as a mount.<Prompt>
The more you use it, the weaker it will get, so eventually you will need to exchange it to a VCS member for a new one.<Prompt>

Only people who have been approved by the VCS President can get <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$  , so good luck with that...<Prompt>
Chococards are documents that contain all the details about a chocobo's attributes and condition. They are divided into two types--one for each gender.<Prompt>
If you trade one to the person who's in charge of matchmaking, he'll introduce your animal to another chocobo.<Prompt>

Chococards contain information on the chocobo's attributes and condition at the time the card is issued, so be sure to get a new card before using this service or the match will be arranged based on out-of-date information.<Prompt>
If you want a chococard for a retired chocobo, then you must trade <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$   to a VCS member.<Prompt>

Why not!. Our original plan was to establish locations across Vana'diel where people could test their birds' skills.<Prompt>
We felt that this would help us maintain breeder motivation, which in turn would ensure healthier, happier chocobos. A  win-win situation,  as we like to call it in the business.<Prompt>
However, as rumors of these new facilities began to leak out into the world, people began speculating about the possibility of officially sanctioned chocobo races...<Prompt>
The VCS could not ignore the voice of the masses, and it was not long before a meeting was held, a vote was taken, and the CRA was formed.<Prompt>
And that's why I'm here, trying to enlist you and other top breeders into our noble ranks.<Prompt>
Oh, and for our more seasoned veterans who feel there are no challenges left for them here at the track, the CRA has finished preparing a new race. And rumor has that it's a doozie!<Prompt>
First of all, your chocobo must be fully grown. It doesn't matter if you are still tending to it, or if it has been sent to pasture, as long as it is large enough to ride.<Prompt>

Next, you must bring me either <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$   or <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$  . This is all I will require. There are no hidden fees.<Prompt>
As your chocobo develops, be sure to re-register it. This will ensure that your steed is provided with the equipment that most suits its current condition.<Prompt>
Finally, you may only register one chocobo at a time, but are free to register a new bird whenever you wish. You need only speak with me to make any necessary changes.<Prompt>
Once you have registered your chocobo and entered it in a competition, the CRA will proceed in assigning it a licensed jockey.<Prompt>
Before each race you will be given the opportunity to give the jockey specific orders on his or her riding style.<Prompt>
In addition to these orders, you can also provide the jockey with items to use while riding, as well as equipment to improve your chocobo's performance.<Prompt>

Before a race, you can also check the strengths and weaknesses of the other participating chocobos. It is recommended that you use this data when deciding on what orders to give, or which items to equip.<Prompt>
Depending on your chocobo's performance in select CRA-sanctioned races, you may or may not receive a prize consisting of VCS-mint <Set colour #5>chocobucks<Set colour #1>.<Prompt>
Chocobucks can be used to purchase items, as well as upgrade your mount. Chocobucks are also required to participate in official races.<Prompt>
Currently, players can earn up to, but no more than, 1000 chocobucks. However, this may change without notice.<Prompt>
There are two main types of races.<Prompt>
The first type is called an <Set colour #5>official race<Set colour #1>. To participate in one of these, you will require chocobucks.<Prompt>
Placing in an official race will earn you gil. The more races you complete, the more respected you will become in the breeder community.<Prompt>
You may also take part in an official race as often as needed to complete the specified objectives.<Prompt>

However, after some of the more grueling races, you may be required to wait before entering the next. This is to give your chocobo, as well as the others, an opportunity to rest before running again.<Prompt>
The second type of race is called a <Set colour #5>free run<Set colour #1>. Unlike the official races, these can be run at any time, regardless of the results of a previous match.<Prompt>

You must pay a fee in gil to participate in free runs, but you will have the opportunity to earn chocobucks depending on your chocobo's performance. You can join as many free runs as you wish in a single day (Earth time), but extra fees may be required for each additional race. (Stable hands have to make a living, too!)<Prompt>
The CRA is split up into three racing teams representing Bastok, Windurst, and San d'Oria.<Prompt>
Each team has its own skilled jockeys, and offers unique services that cannot be obtained at the other two.<Prompt>
Breeders are allowed to register with any team they like, and may change their affiliation at any time.<Prompt>
In the event that you wish to leave a racing team, all official race results, as well as earned chocobucks, will be saved.<Prompt>
You never have to worry that your past accomplishments may be deleted and lost forever. You only need rejoin the team to restore all your old data.<Prompt>

This racetrack is equipped with portals to transport our patrons to any of the three nations, as well as Jeuno and Al Zahbi.<Prompt>

As you can see, we are regularly visited by a multitude of race fans, breeders, and jockeys from every realm imaginable. We have therefore relegated each portal to a single destination in an attempt to avoid congestion.<Prompt>
For the same reasons, we ask that visitors refrain from setting up bazaars while here. Violators of this rule will be severely punished. Your cooperation is appreciated.<Prompt>

What would you like to know about. <Selection Dialog>Racing teams. Race rules. Race types. Victory points. Race Progression. That's about it.<Prompt>
A race chocobo's owner or jockey may join one of the three racing teams by registering at the appropriate VCS branch.<Prompt>
Each nation's Team Victory Points are the sum total of all of its members' Solo Victory Points. The Team Victory Point totals are then used to determine the overall weekly standings.<Prompt>
In order to race your chocobo here, we ask that you please affiliate yourself first with one of the three teams.<Prompt>
For details, please check with your local CRA racing center.<Prompt>
The races held here are almost identical to the official and private races held at the other racetracks.<Prompt>
What distinguishes our races is the fact that victories here qualify you to collect larger cash purses, as well as Victory Points.<Prompt>
Eligibility to participate in the higher-level races will require a certain number of Solo Victory Points.<Prompt>
Depending on a team's weekly standings, its members may suffer certain eligibility restrictions. At the same time, they may also be privy to certain benefits.<Prompt>
The teams in second and third place will have the advantage of being allowed more entry positions in any given race, while those of the leading team are restricted.<Prompt>
The leading team will, however, be granted the privilege of selecting higher-quality saddles for their race chocobos.<Prompt>
The CRA reserves the right to impose a handicap system when it is determined that the gap in skill between chocobos is simply too great to make for a fair race.<Prompt>
In such an event, the  less endowed  of the chocobos will be granted certain enhancing effects, such as Haste or Refresh.<Prompt>
Whether handicaps will be enforced or not will be determined after signups are complete. Make sure to keep an eye on your chocobo's settings.<Prompt>
Each race title will include a code, such as C4. This code is the  race grade. <Prompt>
For example, a  C4 Chocobo Race  would indicate a typical grade 4 race.<Prompt>
We have four race grades, ranging from C4 to C1. The lower the number, the higher the grade. This, of course, means larger entry fees, but also more prize money.<Prompt>

No matter which race you enter, upon completion you will be prevented from joining any other races for a period of 20 hours (Earth time). Higher-grade races carry larger purses, so most racers like to use their opportunities to go after those.<Prompt>
Solo Victory Points will be awarded to you every race, depending on how well you finish.<Prompt>
As your Solo Victory Points accumulate, your chocobo will be able to gain entry to high-grade races.<Prompt>
Should a racer return to the circuit after an absence of four weeks or more, the CRA will be forced to deduct a number of Solo Victory Points.<Prompt>

Only on the rarest of occasions will such penalties be imposed. However, there are some races in which you will be unable to participate if you do not have a certain amount of Solo Victory Points in your possession.<Prompt>
Also, obtaining Solo Victory Points will also grant your nation Team Victory Points.<Prompt>
The three teams are in constant competition with one another, and a weekly ranking system is in place based on Team Victory Point totals.<Prompt>
As a team climbs up in rank, certain benefits will follow. You may see new items available for purchase with chocobucks, preferential treatment at the races, and so on.<Prompt>
Keep in mind that should you change your team affiliation, you will be forced to forfeit any accumulated Solo Victory Points.<Prompt>
We have a total of four races that run in succession.<Prompt>
Each race has its own dedicated signup window. Here there will be four attendants ready to serve all your racing needs.<Prompt>
Even if the race registration at one window closes, registration for the next race will begin immediately at the neighboring window.<Prompt>
Races will be held one after the other, so you'll have plenty of chances to watch and bet. Sit back, relax, and enjoy!<Prompt>
What would you like to hear more about. <Selection Dialog>Race preparations. Signup procedure. Collecting winnings. Signing up for another race. I'm fine, thanks.<Prompt>
There are a few facts that you should know before running in a race.<Prompt>
First of all, you absolutely must be affiliated with one of the three official racing teams. These, as you may already know, are San d'Oria, Bastok, and Windurst.<Prompt>
Secondly, it is required that your bird be registered as a  race chocobo,  for obvious reasons. No race chocobo, no race.<Prompt>
Thirdly, you will be responsible for providing your own items to be used during the race. The CRA leaves this to the racer's discretion...<Prompt>
All of these services can be provided at any racing center, but to facilitate the registration process it is recommended that you conduct all such affairs at the appropriate branch.<Prompt>
A racing fee is necessary to gain entry into a chocobo race. The racing center will inform you of the cost, so please be sure to pay when signing up for a race.<Prompt>
Also, when signing up to race, you will be able to choose a saddle, as well as the lane in which your chocobo will race.<Prompt>

There are multifarious saddles at the rider's disposal, each of which will affect your chocobo's conditioning. In addition, the types of saddles available will change depending on your team's current ranking.<Prompt>
There are a total of eight lanes, but general conditions for all of them are the same. Feel free to race in the lane of your choice.<Prompt>

Setting these options will complete the signup process. You will then be given <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$  , which you will need to exchange later to collect any winnings.<Prompt>

In the event that you should lose or misplace your <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>#  , you will be unable to collect any prize money, chocobucks, or Victory Points that you may be entitled to. I cannot stress enough how important it is to hold on to it.<Prompt>
The races can be viewed from our grandstand area. Take a seat and cheer on your bird!<Prompt>
You will be eligible for prize money if your chocobo places either first, second, or third.<Prompt>
To collect, simply hand in the <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>#   you received during race signup at any signup center.<Prompt>
The amount of gil, chocobucks, and Victory Points you qualify to receive will be based upon your bird's placement.<Prompt>
You will lose the right to collect your winnings from a race exactly one week after that race has ended.<Prompt>
After participating in a race, your chocobo will be unable to join any other races for a period of 20 hours (Earth time).<Prompt>
This pertains only to races held here, and will not affect your eligibility for races held at any other racetracks.<Prompt>
We have implemented these restrictions here as to allow the greatest number of participants' entry into our races. Your patience and understanding are appreciated.<Prompt>
What would you like to ask. <Selection Dialog>What is chocobetting. How do I bet. What are odds. When do I bet. How do I collect winnings. Nothing.<Prompt>
Chocobetting is a form of entertainment where bettors attempt to pick the two birds that will finish first and second in a race.<Prompt>
To make it a bit more interesting, the bettor can then wager on their picks in increments of 100 gil.<Prompt>
Should lady luck smile upon you and your picks hit, you can win prize money, the amount of which is determined by the odds for that race.<Prompt>
For example, let's say that you were to bet ten quills (1000 gil) on Entries No. 5 and No. 7.<Prompt>

And let's say that the toteboard showed the odds for the race at 110 gil. If your picks were to finish as the top two birds, you would be eligible to collect 1100 gil in winnings, for a total profit of 100 gil.<Prompt>
Of course, it goes without saying that should your picks not have the fortune of finishing in the top two places, you will receive absolutely no gil.<Prompt>
The gambler's fallacy is our mantra here at the racetrack! Remember, you are special! Let it ride!<Prompt>
To place a chocobet, you must obtain <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$   from the chocobet center. <Prompt>
For any single <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>#  , a bettor may purchase up to 999 quills. Each quill costs 100 gil.<Prompt>
We highly recommend that you obtain information on the chocobos you will be betting on before purchasing your ticket. It is always good to know where your money is going.<Prompt>
Odds determine how much gil you will receive in winnings per quill on your chocobet ticket.<Prompt>

Winnings are calculated by taking the total monetary sum of all bets for any given pairing. For example, should ten bettors each place the same 100-quill (10,000 gil) chocobet, the total used to determine the winnings would be 100,000 gil.<Prompt>
It goes without saying that not all bettors will be winners. The money from losing bets is used to pay off the winners.<Prompt>
What this means is that if you place a bet on an unseemly chocobo pairing, or pick two birds without much money riding on them, and are fortunate enough to win, you can make quite a tidy sum.<Prompt>

Toteboards display the odds at both the chocobet center as well as the grandstand. Toteboards have eight columns with the number on top of each column representing one chocobo, and the number to the left of each column representing another. If your bet is for chocobos No. 2 and No. 5, check the #2 column to see how much a 2-5 bet will pay per quill.<Prompt>
The odds are constantly changing right up until the race begins. If the number of bets on a popular chocobo pairing keeps increasing, then consequently the odds will go down.<Prompt>
Even if you place a large bet early on, the odds may still change as time passes. So take your time and consider carefully.<Prompt>
Chocobets can be placed as soon as the signup period for a race has ended. The betting window will close several minutes before the race begins.<Prompt>
Make sure to get your bet in on time. Even if you are in the middle of placing a bet, it will be cancelled if you exceed the allowed time window by even a single second.<Prompt>
Once the race is finished, you can exchange your <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>#   at any chocobet center to collect your winnings.<Prompt>
Without <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$   you will be unable to collect your winnings, so make sure not to lose it.<Prompt>
